attributes.action: A new and safe Concrete Skatepark for Hitchin, Hertfordshire.
attributes.additional_details:
The current skatepark at King Georges is unsafe and not up to date with health and safety regulations. 
Skateboarding is a great way to keep fit and healthy.
Skateboarding will keep the youth away from antisocial behaviour.
There is a new skate shop in town and there is a large demand for a new skatepark in Hitchin.
Letchworth has the closest local skatepark and it gets too busy which makes it unsafe.
Metal skateparks are unsafe. It needs to be a concrete skatepark.
attributes.background: We would like a new skatepark based in Hitchin, Hertfordshire. I work at the local skate shop in Hitchin and there is a demand for a local concrete skatepark. All other towns and most villages have skateparks and Hitchin shouldn't be without one. The current skatepark is unsafe and not fit for use.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions on planning and local amenities are a matter for your local council.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
